result.execSummary:
Donald J Whiteford was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Donald J Whiteford was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

defendant.name: Whiteford, Donald J

records.addlTxt: End of representation letter filed by Atty. Hughes.
Review hearing on August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Donald J Whiteford
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 1929 Jade Ln, Eagan, MN 55122
Warrant for Commitment, signed by Commissioner Rieck on 06/22/2022.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

02:04 PM Defendant Donald J Whiteford in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint, affidavit, and warrant for commitment and waives reading.  Court conducts waiver of extradition colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant wants to waive extradition.  Court accepts the waiver of extradition.  Court signs the waiver of extradition and warrant for commitment.  State of Minnesota is to be notified ASAP to pick up the defendant.  The State is asking for cash bail.  Attorney Hughes is asking for a signature bond.  The Court believes setting bail is appropriate.  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
